reviews.review_msg: This class was super interesting! I find the archaeology department does not offer many classes  that fall under the historical category, and therefore this one was super interesting. Deb is a good lecturer, although her lectures tend to be long. The midterm was a bit uncalled for but luckily the final was the same format so you knew what to expect

Deborah is absolutely amazing! She loves what she teaches and that is obvious in her lectures. She tells great stories and is clear about what she expects on exams. Tough marker, but if you work hard you will do fine. She cares so much about her students...refreshing! I would take any course I could with her :)

I've wanted to take a class with her since I was 18 years old. We had 30% participation, so show up and have something insightful to say about the readings, and 70% was a group presentation, in which the only criteria was to not make her fall asleep. We had so much freedom. She's a gem and the sweetest lady alive.
